Text.Text: I'm listening.
I admire your courage, stranger.  My name is Illium Ar'Ghrenoir.  You have approached in peace, so in good faith I will grant you brief audience.
By Auril, no, you may not.  If you attempt to take this pass by force, you will fail.

Several years ago we came from the south, near the hilt of the Sword Coast, traveling to this frigid land to escape the stench of humanity.  It was here that Odea and I vanquished a filthy clan of verbeeg giants abusing the land, and converted their camp into this hamlet Andora.
Soldiers emerging from Luskan and other southern towns are instruments of war, and Auril will not allow their interference.  Many trespassers have died already - as will you if you continue.
A deal has been struck and will be honored.  If Auril wished you to pass, I would stand aside - regretfully it is not Her will.
Long ago in the groves of Cloak Wood - myself a mere child - a horde of savages washed over our land, killing our men, enslaving our children, burning our homes... and our women, they...
Odea and her druids worship Auril, and I am their sworn protector.
Sometimes one must deal with a Baatezu to defeat a Tanar'ri.  Sometimes one must claw through a beast's evil shell to reach the good held within... *sometimes* that evil claws into you instead.
*This* is the world that Odea and the others were born into.  I vowed to NEVER let what their parents endured happen to them.
I will allow it.
Yes, what is it you are to know?
Ask your questions with haste.
Yes?

A young giant named Goublika *did* escape when we defeated his clan, and I *know* what damage a vengeful heart can do...  If you still desire passage, wait here while I deal with this problem personally.
Your words are my resolve, and shall be heeded.  How quickly do I leap at the chance to stain my hands with further blood?!  I've truly lost my way...
I admire your courage, stranger.  My name is Illium Ar'Ghrenoir.  You have invaded my home, and you shall pay dearly for your trespass.
I've nothing left to declare.  Our blades will speak for us now!
Odea, you have the passion and resourcefulness of a true leader, but your emotions cripple you.  Please return this *creature* to wherever you found it.
All that is left for me to say is-
Indeed they are, but *you're* an immediate threat so I'll deal with you first.
I have granted you safe passage through Andora, and you will receive no further assistance from us, so be on your way.
Is that so...?  Perhaps it's for the better - my hands have been stained with too much blood already.
We've nothing more to discuss - be on your way.
It was not our doing.  Your pilot showed mercy in veering his vessel away from our home - in return we will not disturb him while he repairs it.
Yes, the path running through Andora will lead you there.
Thrym is the heat secretion of the great polar worms - the remorhaz.  You can extract a flask's worth from their slain bodies... assuming you survive the encounter.
Yes, but since it's quite scarce this time of year, it is neither available for sale nor trade.
I do not.
You spoke bold works to my friend, Odea.  Are you *so* bold that you would attempt to do the same here, in the midst of our community?
You told Odea that you could placate the fury of Auril.  Brave words.  What is it you seek?
You face not Auril's wrath in me, traveler.  I am simply the guardian of this community.  Now, what is it you desire?

Stranger, although I fear repercussions for letting you pass through, I must admit that I have a greater fear what you will do to Andora if I do not.  You have my *reluctant* permission to pass.  Please do so, with haste.
If you truly believe that you can stay Auril's hand from devastating our village, I will let you pass.  We have no wish for conflict, but we can offer you no further aid.
May we pass safely through this area?
Why are you here?
Why have you laid traps throughout these foothills?
No one owns these foothills.  What gives you the right to deny passage?
Did you cause my airship to crash?
Can you tell me how to get to the glacier blocking the Western Pass?
Do you have any belladonna?
That is all I wished to know.  Farewell.
We've no more questions, but we still must pass through your town.
That is all I wished to know.  Farewell.
We've no more questions, but we still must pass through your town.
I'd like to ask a few questions.
Your reign of terror in these foothills ends now!
I desire nothing.  Farewell.
I desire nothing.  Farewell.
I have more questions.

You're not going to get a chance to honor it, Illium.  In fact, you won't even get a chance to be punished for dishonoring it.  We *massacred* the goblin army at Shaengarne.  Do you think your feeble band of tundra scavengers is going to stop us?

Auril's wishes are *irrelevant.*  I am a Stormlord of Talos.  If Aurilian priests have told you to bar our passage, I am telling you to *ignore* that command.  Auril bows to Talos, and so her worshippers will bow to *me.*

If you do not let us pass immediately, I will call down hail and lightning on this village in Talos' name.  Those not charred into unrecognizable lumps of flesh will be crushed by hailstones the size of your head.  Do you understand?

Auril's power is *nothing* compared to the might of Bane!  You fear her because she might freeze your worthless plants?  If you don't let us pass *immediately,* I will slay you and magically dominate your panther friend.  I'll make the rest of your village watch while she devours your flesh.

After every cold winter night comes a warm dawn.  Instead of cowering before a cruel tyrant you fear, why not turn towards the light of Lathander?  Let me deal with the Aurilians, and you will not suffer.
Brother, have you lost your way?  You worship Auril, yet her evil nature defies the very core of our beliefs.
Why do you worship Auril?
I see.  Farewell.
I see.  Farewell.
What do you have against humanity?
I have more questions.
I see.  Farewell.
I see.  Farewell.

You're not going to get a chance to honor it, Illium.  In fact, you won't even get a chance to be punished for dishonoring it.  We *massacred* the goblin army at Shaengarne.  Do you think your feeble band of tundra scavengers is going to stop us?

Auril's wishes are *irrelevant.*  I am a Stormlord of Talos.  If Aurilian priests have told you to bar our passage, I am telling you to *ignore* that command.  Auril bows to Talos, and so her worshippers will bow to *me.*

Brother, have you lost your way?  You worship Auril, yet her evil nature defies the very core of our beliefs.
Why do you worship Auril?
I have more questions.
I see.  Farewell.
I see.  Farewell.

I have more questions.
I see.  Farewell.
I see.  Farewell.

I have more questions.
I see.  Farewell.
I see.  Farewell.
I have more questions.
I see.  Farewell.
I see.  Farewell.
All right.
We took care of him already.  He's dead.
We took care of him already.  He won't be harming you.
You're going to solve it with more violence?  What has that done for you and your people except cause more misery?
No.  Grant us passage now - then you can deal with the giants.
Wait!  I've questions to ask you.
Your reign of terror in these foothills ends here!
I'll be leaving now.  Farewell.
Wait, I'd like to ask a few questions.
Your reign of terror in these foothills ends now!
Farewell, then.
I'd like to ask something else.
Then let's get this over with!
I have more questions.
I see.  Farewell.
I see.  Farewell.
I have more questions.
I see.  Farewell.
I see.  Farewell.
I have more questions.
I see.  Farewell.
I see.  Farewell.
I have more questions.
I see.  Farewell.
I see.  Farewell.
I have more questions.
I see.  Farewell.
I see.  Farewell.
I certainly would.  We have no fear of you, your community, or Auril herself.
I just want to ask you some questions.
The time for speaking is over.  Flee now or lie dead in our wake.
I have some questions for you.
Your death.  NOW!
I have some questions for you.
Your death.  NOW!
Good.  Get out of my way.
Good.  Get out of my way.
Farewell then.
Farewell then.
